bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: How did Francis seek to live the divine mysteries of the Christian faith?
questions.correctAnswer: With his heart, spirit and emotions

questions.question: How is the Christian understanding of Incarnation connected with the celebration of Christmas?
questions.correctAnswer: Instead of being remote from humanity up in heaven God takes on human form by being born of a virgin as Jesus. In this way God revealed himself to humanity. The celebration of Christmas is the manifestation of God as a child in all his weakness, neediness and dependance as God's loving kindness to the world
distractors: Christmas celebrates the birth of the Messiah promised in prophecy
Christmas marks when God sent angels to announce his plan
Christmas commemorates when wise men brought gifts to the king
Christmas remembers when shepherds first worshiped Jesus
Christmas honors Mary for accepting God's call

questions.question: What was the sign of poverty for Francis in the birth of the Son of God?
questions.correctAnswer: That the Son of God was born in a stable
distractors: That Mary and Joseph were poor
That Jesus had no crib or bed
That the family fled to Egypt
That shepherds were the first visitors
That they had no room at the inn

questions.question: Francis is credited with creating what Christian devotion to help the faithful understand the Incarnation?
Where did this Christian devotion first take place?
questions.correctAnswer: In a small village in the Rieti valley near Rome, Greccio
distractors: In Rome at Saint Peter's Basilica
In Bethlehem at the Church of the Nativity
In Jerusalem at the Holy Sepulchre

questions.question: What did Francis want to include in this devotion?
questions.correctAnswer: A manger with hay and an ox and donkey nearby

questions.question: How did people hear that a new devotion was going to take place at Christmas?
Why was Francis joyful when he arrived at the location of this devotion?
questions.correctAnswer: Great crowds had come to join him in witnessing the manger and the animals and to praise God on this holy night
distractors: The weather was perfect for the celebration
The Pope had sent his blessing
His family had reconciled with him

questions.question: How did Francis participate in the Christmas Mass celebrated over the manger?
questions.correctAnswer: As a deacon, he read the holy Gospel and preached the homily
distractors: As a priest, he celebrated the Mass
As an altar server, he assisted the priest
As a cantor, he led the singing
As a lector, he read the first reading
As a simple observer in prayer

questions.question: What ordinary object was collected and preserved from the manger that would be used in a holy way?
What was ultimately built over the grotto where the manger was on this Christmas day in Greccio?
questions.correctAnswer: First an altar and finally a church

questions.question: How did Francis' focus on Jesus being born in a simple manger change how people celebrated Christmas?
questions.correctAnswer: It helped people focus more on Jesus' human life and humble beginnings, and it inspired the tradition of recreating the nativity scene each year
distractors: It made Christmas more solemn and less joyful
It shifted focus from gifts to charity
It encouraged fasting instead of feasting
It replaced the Christmas Mass with outdoor services
It made Christmas the most important feast day
